newsitem.title: CANADA: Brascan Brazil sets US$50 mln notes issue.
newsitem.headline: Brascan Brazil sets US$50 mln notes issue.

text.p: Brascan Ltd said on Wednesday its wholly owned Brascan Brazil Ltd agreed with underwriters for the issue and sale of floating rate senior notes in the aggregate amount of US$50 million, due November 12, 2004.
Proceeds of the issue would be used by Brascan's Brazilian operations to reduce short-term debt and for other corporate purposes, Brascan said.
It said its capital investment program in Brazil is being self-funded by Brascan Brazil using its operating cash flows and own sources of capital.

Recent developments in the program include the opening of the US$90 million Sao Paulo Intercontinental Hotel, completion of the US$56 million Condominium Club Ibirapuera in Sao Paulo, a US$43 million expansion of shopping centre operations in Rio de Janeiro, formation of Aurizona Goldfields Corp and the consideration of a new forest products plant in southern Brazil, expected to cost about US$175 million.
